byline.contributor: Kareem Fahim contributed reporting from Cairo, Dimitris Bounias from Athens, and Andreas Riris from Nicosia, Cyprus.
byline.original: By DECLAN WALSH and NOUR YOUSSEF

abstract: Fugitive Egyptian convict Seif Eldin Mustafa hijacks EgyptAir passenger plane en route from Cairo to Alexandria, diverting it to Cyprus and issuing set of puzzling demands before surrendering to authorities; among Mustafa's demands are that all female inmates be releases from Egyptian prisons and that he be allowed to see his ex-wife in Cyprus; no one is hurt in incident
lead_paragraph: A man claiming to wear an explosive vest forced an EgyptAir plane to land in Cyprus before he was arrested. He had issued an incoherent set of demands, and wanted to see his ex-wife.

headline.main: No One Hurt as EgyptAir Flight Is Forced to Cyprus in a Hijacking From the Heart
headline.print_headline: No One Is Hurt in a Hijacking From the Heart

snippet: A man claiming to wear an explosive vest forced an EgyptAir plane to land in Cyprus before he was arrested. He had issued an incoherent set of demands, and wanted to see his ex-wife.
